Description: Fragment from the neck and shoulder of a vessel: an exact duplicate of 1894,0816.48. Of opaque yellow glass, glossy surface. Prefabricated 'eyes' of opaque dark blue, containing immediately within the circumference a single opaque white thread, were impressed into the outer surface at irregular intervals. The core is a darker tan than that of 1894,0816.48, therefore it is improbable that they are from the same vessel. The shape was probably an amphora with globular body.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: A well-established type of glassware at Thebes and El-Amarna. Bibliography: R. Freed, 'Pharaohs of the Sun', (Boston 2000), p. 266 [217] Wrongly numbered as EA 68393 R. Freed, 'Farao's van de Zon', (Leiden 2000), p. 266 [217]. Wrongly numbered as EA 68393.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1999 14 Nov-2000 6 Feb, USA, Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Pharaohs of the Sun : Akhenaten Nefertiti Tutakhamen
